key_points: Campus safety is a major concern following a deadly shooting at Oxford High School in Michigan.
A student was arrested for making an apparent threat on social media targeting a school in Orange County.
A 15-year-old student at Oxford High School faces terrorism and murder charges after a shooting left four dead and seven injured.
The student's parents have been charged with involuntary manslaughter.
Incidents leading up to the Oxford shooting included the student's troubling behavior and drawings.
Despite concerning signs, the student was not removed from school the day of the shooting.
Oxford Community Schools Superintendent Tim Throne stated a third-party investigation into the events will be conducted.
Local schools, including McGaugh Elementary, are reviewing and discussing safety protocols.
Los Alamitos Unified School District emphasizes the importance of Comprehensive School Safety Plans and has a Threat Assessment Team.
The community remains committed to ensuring the safety of all students and staff on school campuses.
spokespersons: Dr. Issaic Gates (Principal, McGaugh Elementary School)
Phil Gonshak (Police Chief, Seal Beach Police Department)
